mads:mads.mads:note: His Palliata, fragmenta [CF] 1991: PHI CD ROM #5.3, Latin Canon, bibliographic screen (Aquilius)
Pauly-Wissowa: 3. Halbbd., col. 323; "Aquilius", #3 (Aquilius; supposed author of the Boeotia, ascribed by Varro to Plautus)
Oxford class. dict., 1st ed.: p. 75 (Aquilius; fl. c. 174-154 B.C.; supposed Latin author of Boeotia (Boeotis?), a comoedia palliata ascribed by Varro to Plautus)
Smith's Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology, Vol , 1867, p. 1:

Brill's New Pauly: "Aquillius, 16, Poet of the Roman comedy ( Palliata) in the 2nd cent. BC,in the age of Caecilius and Terence, identified by Mantero with Atilius. Boeotia, a comedy that was ascribed to him, was modelled after Menander or Diphilus....." Blänsdorf, Jürgen (Mainz). Aquillius." Brill's New Pauly. Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and Helmuth Schneider . Brill, 2008. Brill Online. Tufts University Library
